entry.title: Third-party sync API (Esay Period)
entry.content:
Third-party sync API (Esay Period)

Base URL: your server endpoint (e.g. https://example.com/api/xxx).

Auth

If the user enters an API Key in the app, it is sent as:

If left blank, no Authorization header is added.

Upload

POST {base}

Returns: JSON with code, message, and optional data from server.

Download

GET {base}/?user_id=xxx&app_name=EsayPeriod&sync_type=download

Response data should be an array of entries in the same shape as upload data (fields listed above). The app merges/overwrites based on the selected mode. Optional Basic Auth headers are sent when username/password are provided in the UI.

entry.content:
ğŸ‘‹ Hello, Iâ€™m Harry

Iâ€™m an independent developer passionate about creating meaningful applications that respect user freedom and privacy.

ğŸ’¡ My Philosophy

I believe in the power of small but beautiful apps â€” tools that do one thing exceptionally well without unnecessary complexity.

Your data belongs to you. Iâ€™m committed to building applications where your personal information stays in your hands, not uploaded to corporate servers for advertising or profit. In an era of data exploitation, I believe itâ€™s time for software to return to its essence: serving users, not surveilling them.

Privacy is not about having something to hide. Itâ€™s about having something to protect: your autonomy, your dignity, and your right to be yourself.

ğŸ¯ What I Do

I create tools that:

  • âœ¨ Prioritize user experience over feature bloat
  • ğŸ”’ Keep your data local and secure
  • ğŸŒ± Respect your time and attention
  • ğŸš€ Focus on simplicity and elegance

Every line of code I write is guided by one principle: technology should empower individuals, not exploit them.

ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸ Beyond the Screen

When Iâ€™m not coding, youâ€™ll find me:

  • ğŸ›¹ Skateboarding through city streets
  • ğŸš´ Cycling on scenic routes
  • ğŸš¶ Power walking to clear my mind

These activities remind me that the best solutions often come when we step away from the keyboard and reconnect with the physical world.

ğŸŒ My Values

  • User sovereignty: You should control your technology, not the other way around
  • Digital minimalism: Less is more when it comes to features
  • Open communication: Transparency builds trust
  • Continuous learning: Every project is an opportunity to grow
  • Sustainability: Building for the long term, not quick profits

ğŸ“¬ Get in Touch

Iâ€™m always excited to connect with fellow developers, designers, and users who share these values.

  • ğŸ“§ Email: haoleiq@gmail.com
  • ğŸŒ Website: harry-1012.github.io/app

Whether you have a question, feedback, or just want to chat about technology and user freedom, feel free to reach out!

â€œThe best technology is the technology you donâ€™t notice â€” it simply works, respects you, and gets out of your way.â€
